A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This movie was better than I walked in expecting it's not as good as some of the original trilogy but better than most of the prequels and besides a few cheesy moments like in episode VII and a few badly written moments in the script it's a solid Star Wars that brings the cast around from the most part and has much better battle scenes while doing so. The movie creeps along for a while in the beginning to middle of the film but finishes with a bang. So we're there flaws? Yes but not as many as Episode I II and VII
